basic_info.description: Jeremy Adamson currently resides in Saint Louis after relocating several times throughout the United States. They hold degrees from University of California Irvine in both computational physics and computational mathematics along with a California teaching credential. They currently work at Boeing as a systems integrator and OMS lead after taking time out of their career to be a stay at home parent and will be pursuing a Master's in computer science next fall.

projects.title: Fruits and Friends
projects.description: Final project for Codefellows 201 involving creation of a web version of the Niya inspired board game. Personal contribution included coding the base data structures and the creation of single player mode utilizing a recursive mini-max algorithm.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: An app which gives sales projections for several stores based upon given parameters.

projects.title: Physics Thesis
projects.description: Ten week superconductivity and Bose-Einstein condensate self-led experiment combining multiple programming languages (C++, Matlab, and Mathematica) to convert and analyze native output readings down to 0.1K with liquid helium.
